conclusion: Initial position of light source is closer to the objects.
Shadows A, B, C, D are cast on the ground.
Shadows are directly underneath or slightly to the side of the objects.
Shadows are relatively large due to the proximity of the light source.
The light source moves backward, further away from the objects.
Shadows shift closer to the objects as the light source moves backward.
Shadows become smaller due to the light source moving backward.
Shadow of the cone moves closer to the cone and becomes smaller.
Shadow of the sphere moves closer to the sphere and decreases in size.
Shadow of the square object shifts closer and reduces in size.
Shadow of the rectangular object moves closer to the object and shrinks in size.
Final shadow characteristics: Shadows are closer to their respective objects and smaller.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D move closer to the objects and become smaller.
